intro: Centaurea stoebe, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces clusters of purple or pink flowers. The plant has small, hairy leaves and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea stoebe is also known for its ability to spread rapidly and is considered a potential invasive species in some regions.
